intro: Greeniopsis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy greeniopsis, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
